data.title: focusonyouth
data.text:
Serving with Excellence

Everyone at Focus on Youth, from interns to executive director, shares a passion for helping kids reach their full potential. Our staff is carefully selected and extensively trained to be the best advocates for children and partners to families, both birth and foster, in the area.

Alicia Ajiboye, LISW-S

Executive Director

Team Player since: 2021

Loves spending time with family and, shopping, and traveling. Favorite place to be is at a beach. Loves to sing and really enjoys listening to Elevation Worship, Tasha Cobbs, and many others.

Sid Taylor

Assistant Executive Director

Team Player since: 2023

Born and raised in Cincinnati. Happily married (his wife is his best friend) with one young adult son and one teenage daughter. Is a die-hard Bengals fan, fair-weather Reds fan and probably one of the biggest Ohio State Buckeyes Football fans you’ll ever meet. O-H!!!!

Administration

The Finance and Administrative department manages the day-to-day business details that make our organization productive, effective, and healthy. From staffing to building improvements and money management, this team is the engine that keeps everything we do for youth and families on track.

Penny Dougan, BSBA

Operations Manager

Team player since: 1996

Has worked at Focus on Youth over 27 years! Is a huge Ohio State Buckeye fan. Loves Michael Jackson’s music. Has been on 5 mission trips to Haiti and cannot wait to return.

Dylan Chambers

Administrative Assistant

Team player since: 2024

Recently graduated from Florida State University with an MA in Philosophy, doing research centered on applied ethics. Lover of comics, most music genres, and playing video games or watching TV shows with his wife.

Jacquie Campbell

Administrative Assistant

Team player since: 2024

Born and raised in Cincinnati. Loves spending quality time with my family and teenage daughter. Enjoys camping or “glamping” if you will, thrifting for treasures, antique malls and going to comedy shows.

Joe Bruns

Quality Improvement Coordinator

Team player since: 2021

I am a husband and father. I have travelled or drove through 46 of the 48 states of the continental United States. Connoisseur of Mexican food and never met a taco I did not like.

Foster Care & Adoption

Our Foster Care and Adoption staff works to find, train, and support foster parents. Youth Specialists provide supervision of youth in placement, foster family support, recertification of homes, and coordination of community services. Family Assessors do the same while also performing homestudies and family assessments for new foster homes. Case Assistants offer administrative support and may also assist foster families needing help getting children to family visits and appointments.

Christina Kappen, MSW, LISW-S

Foster Care and Adoption Manager

Team player since: 2004

Loving mother of her 3 children. Grew up alongside foster and adoptive children as her parents were foster and adoptive parents. Is secretly addicted to playing her child’s farming game on his tablet.

Joselin Laib, MSW, LSW

Placement Services Supervisor

Team player since: 2017

Super hero enthusiast. Helped inform legislators on child topics, aiding in passage of the bill that provided funding for the Bridges program. Has traveled to 27 states and plans to hit all 50.

Patty Jatczak, LSW

Licensing Team Lead

Team player since: 2005

A pure cheesehead/proud Green Bay Packers’ fan. Born and raised near Lake Geneva, Wisconsin. Has a degree in Social Work and Education from UW-Wisconsin. Moved to Cincinnati in 1989. An adoptive and birth parent who wants to help others grow their families through foster and adoption.

Cierra Scott, BSW

Bridges Liaison

Team player since: 2022

Girl Mom and dog Mom. I love my family and traveling! Movie fanatic! Living out my purpose and helping others is what I was meant to do. #SocialWorkIsLife

Barb Snelling, MSW, LSW

Youth Specialist & Family Assessor

Team player since: 2014

Avid scrapbooker who was a former foster parent. Adopted two girls and went back to college at 50 years old to earn a degree in social work.

Sarah Feine, MSW, LSW

Youth Specialist & Family Assessor

Team player since: 2016

Married into a Minnesota Vikings family and now has two border collies named after players. Romania was her home her senior year of college. Grew up in a family who opened their doors to children in foster care.

Brooke Leggett

Youth Specialist

Team player since:2022

I am a recent NSULA graduate with a degree in Criminal Justice. I was born and raised in Connecticut for most of my life , however I moved back to Ohio this year after living in Louisiana for almost three years. I am a proud dog mom of two. One of which being a Great Dane/ English Mastiff mix named “little man” and the other being a Cane Corso named Biscuit.

Savannah Taylor

Youth Specialist

Team player since:2023

Graduated from the University of Cincinnati with a BS in Criminal Justice and a Law and Paralegal Studies Certificate. Proud cat mom of 5, Batman enthusiast and enjoys travelling. Passion for helping children and families.

Lindsey Halasz

Youth Specialist

Team player since:2023

A recent Miami University graduate. Loves to sing and jam out to music. Is an avid lover of Indian food, cats and all things Disney! (Even worked in Disney World for 8 Months!)

Mary Solomon

Case Assistant

Team player since: 2017

Wife and mother of 2 grown daughters, 5 grandchildren, and 3 great-grandchildren. Lived in Detroit, Michigan for 30 years where she met and sang with both the Spinners.

Janette Lowe

Case Assistant

Team player since: 2019

Born and raised in Michigan – GO BLUE

Married to husband for 30 years and still going strong. Mother of 4 kids, a dog, and a cat. Loves to vacation with her family on cruise ships.

Kara Baumer

Case Assistant

Team player since: 2021

Married to my amazing husband for 23 years and a proud momma of a teenage daughter and a young adult son. I have a passion for helping people, mostly kiddos. Enjoys learning, growing, and listening to motivational videos.

Lillian Lochard

Case Assistant

Team player since: 2023

Loves Cincinnati, has lived here her whole life. One of 4 & is the only girl. She loves going on walks, spending quality time with friends and family and is a huge coffee lover.

Leah Weimer, MSW, LISW-S

Supervisor

Team player since: 2010

Trauma Responsive Care certified

Avid Xavier basketball fan. The youngest of four girls, one of which is her twin sister. Spent time at UD and UC getting her bachelor‘s and master’s degrees.

Brittaney Englemon

Recruiter

Team player since: 2021

Loves spending time with family. A huge fan of University of Kentucky basketball and University of Michigan football. Finds riding horses, listening to music, and being in the mountains therapeutic. Would love to visit Rome one day.

Megan McQueen

Recruiter

Team player since: 2021

Proud to be a social worker for children and families for the last 15 years. Has had a strong desire for advocacy for vulnerable populations at a young age. Momma to two boys and dogs with my loving husband.

Deja Williams

Recruiter

Team player since: 2021

Graduate from Wright State University with bachelor’s in social work. Love working with kids of all ages. Large F.R.I.E.N.D.S tv show obsession. Loves to read and travel. Avid TJ MAXX shopper. Wish I could spend everyday at the beach with my husband, and our toes in the sand.

Sarah Dickerson

Recruiter

Team player since: 2023

Has a master’s degree in Trauma Studies which required her to endure winters in Vermont. Lover of people and their stories. Would always rather be reading and drinking Yoo-hoo out of a juice box. Owns way too many shoes.

Rachel Smith, QMHS+3

Recruiter

Team player since: 2023

Ohio State University graduate with a BS in Social Work and a Youth Development minor. Loves to travel and hopes to visit Europe one day. Avid reader, movie watcher and tv-show binger; some of my favorites being all MARVEL films, Harry Potter, New Girl, FRIENDS, and Outlander. Enjoys spending time outdoors and being with friends and family.

Tracy Faber, LISW-S, CTRP, Registered Play Therapist-Supervisor

Clinical Director

Team player since: 2005

Grew up in Tennessee, near the Smokey Mountains. Loves hiking and camping. Loves playing games and is renowned around the office for being competitive. Grew up with a love and passion for children in foster care as her parents and extended family were foster parents.

Amy Shull, LISW-S, CTRP, Registered Play Therapist

Clinical Supervisor

Team player since: 2013

Considered being a storm chaser, stunt double, or accountant before deciding on becoming a therapist. Has traveled to every state in the US. Her family adopts a family in need instead of exchanging Christmas gifts every year.

Maura Hartmann, MSW, LSW, CTRS-C

Youth and Family Therapist

Team Player since 2023

Born and raised in Cincinnati. Loves the Bearcats, Bengals, Cyclones, Reds, and FCC. Can be found with her husband playing with their son in her free time. Avid marine life advocate especially sea turtles and sharks. Found her love of play again while interning at Focus.

Sydney Day, CTRS-C

Qualified Behavioral Health Specialist

Team Player since 2023

Graduated from University of Kentucky in December 2021. Lived in Cincinnati for 21 years. Loves to be outside, by the water, and with friends. She loves dogs and seeing people smile and laugh. She hopes to one day take her dream vacation to Sydney, Australia.

Emily Ballard

Training Coordinator

Team player since: 2016

Graduated with a degree in Early Childhood Education and decided she’d much rather teach adults. Spent two years fostering three teenagers and two toddlers with her high school sweetheart turned husband and their two boys. She loves being with people but also loves curling up with a good book in hand.
